    Who among them could have revealed this?
    Who among them could have foretold this to us?
        They should bring their witnesses to prove that they were right.
            Let the people hear them. Then they will say that it is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are my witnesses,” declares Yahweh.
    “I have chosen you as my servant
    so that you can know and believe in me
        and understand that I am the one who did this.
    No god was formed before me,
    and there will be none after me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I alone am Yahweh,
    and there is no savior except me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have revealed it to you, I have saved you,
    and I have announced it to you.
        There was no foreign god among you.
    You are my witnesses that I am El,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“From the first day I was the one who did this.
    No one can rescue people from my power.
    When I do something, who can undo it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh, your Go’el, Qedosh Yisrael, says:
For your sake I will send an army to Babylon.
    I will bring back all the Babylonian refugees
        in the ships that they take pride in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am Yahweh, your Holy One,
    the Creator of Israel, your Melek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh makes a path through the sea
    and a road through the strong currents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He leads chariots and horses, an army and reinforcements.
    (They lie down together and do not get up again.
    They are extinguished and snuffed out like a wick.)
This is what Yahweh says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forget what happened in the past,
    and do not dwell on events from long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am going to do something new.
    It is already happening. Don’t you recognize it?
        I will clear a way in the desert.
        I will make rivers on dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wild animals, jackals, and ostriches will honor me.
    I will provide water in the desert.
    I will make rivers on the dry land for my chosen people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have formed these people for myself.
    They will praise me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jacob, you have not prayed to me.
    Israel, you have grown tired of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You did not bring me sheep for your burnt offerings
    or honor me with your sacrifices.
    I did not burden you by requiring grain offerings
    or trouble you by requiring incense offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You did not buy me any sugar cane with your money
    or satisfy me with the best part of your sacrifices.
    Rather, you burdened me with your sins
    and troubled me with your wrongdoings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I alone am the one who is going to wipe away your rebellious actions
    for my own sake.
        I will not remember your sins anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remind me of what happened.
    Let us argue our case together.
        State your case so that you can prove you are right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your first ancestor sinned,
    and your priests rebelled against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why I will corrupt the leaders of the holy place.
    I will claim Jacob for destruction.
    I will set up Israel for ridicule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now listen, my servant Jacob,
    Israel, whom I have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh made you, formed you in the womb, and will help you.
This is what Yahweh says:
Don’t be afraid, my servant Jacob,
    Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pour water on thirsty ground and rain on dry land.
    I will pour my Ruach on your offspring
    and my blessing on your descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will spring up with the grass
    as poplars spring up by streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One person will say, “I belong to Yahweh.”
    Another will call on the name of Jacob.
        Another will write on his hand, “Yahweh’s,”
            and he will adopt the name of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is Israel’s Melek and Go’el.
    He is Yahweh Tsebaoth.
This is what Yahweh says:
I am the first and the last,
    and there is no Elohim except me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If there is anyone like me, let him say so.
    Let him tell me what happened
        when I established my people long ago.
    Then let him predict what will happen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t be terrified or afraid.
    Didn’t I make this known to you long ago?
        You are my witnesses.
            Is there any Elohim except me?
                There is no other rock; I know of none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who make idols are nothing. Their precious treasures are worthless. Their own witnesses do not see or know anything, so they will be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing comes from making gods or casting metal idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone associated with the gods will be put to shame. The craftsmen themselves are only human. Let them all get together and take their stand. They will be frightened and ashamed together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blacksmiths shape iron into tools. They work them over the coals and shape them with hammers, working them with their strong arms. They get hungry, and their strength fails. If they don’t drink water, they will faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carpenters measure blocks of wood with chalk lines. They mark them with pens. They carve them with chisels and mark them with compasses. They carve them into forms of people, beautiful people, so the idols can live in shrines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cut down cedars for themselves. Then they choose fir trees or oaks. They let them grow strong among the trees in the forest. Then they plant cedars, and the rain makes them grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These trees become fuel for people to burn. So they take some of them and warm themselves with them. They start fires and bake bread. They also make gods from these trees and worship them. They make them into carved statues and bow in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Half of the wood they burn in the fire. Over this half they roast meat that they can eat until they are full. They also warm themselves and say, “Ah! We are warm. We can see the fire!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the rest of the wood they make into gods, carved statues. They bow to them and worship them. They pray to them, saying, “Rescue us, because you are our gods.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They don’t know or understand anything. Their eyes are plastered shut, so they can’t see. And their minds are closed, so they can’t understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one stops to think. No one has enough knowledge or understanding to say, “I burned half of the wood in the fire. I also baked bread over its coals. I roasted meat and ate it. Now I am making the rest of the wood into a disgusting thing and bowing to a block of wood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They eat ashes because they are deceived. Their own misguided minds lead them astray. They can’t rescue themselves or ask themselves, “Isn’t what I hold in my right hand a false god?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember these things, Jacob:
    You are my servant, Israel.
        I formed you; you are my servant.
            Israel, I will not forget you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made your rebellious acts disappear like a thick cloud
    and your sins like the morning mist.
    Come back to me, because I have reclaimed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing with joy, you heavens, because Yahweh has done this.
    Rejoice, you deep places of the earth.
    Break into shouts of joy, you mountains,
    you forests and every tree in them.
        Yahweh has reclaimed Jacob.
            He will display his glory in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh reclaimed you.
    He formed you in the womb.
This is what Yahweh says:
I, Yahweh, made everything.
    I stretched out the heavens by myself.
    I spread out the earth all alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cause the signs of false prophets to fail
    and make fools of fortunetellers.
    I make wise men retreat
    and turn their knowledge into foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He confirms the word of his servant
    and fulfills the plan of his messengers.
    He says about Jerusalem, “It will be inhabited.”
    He says about the cities of Judah, “They will be rebuilt.”
    He says about their ruins, “I will restore them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says to the deep water, “Dry up.”
    So I will dry up your rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says about Cyrus, “He is my shepherd.
    He will do everything I want him to do.”
    He says about Jerusalem, “It will be rebuilt.”
    He says about the temple, “Your foundation will be laid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says about Cyrus, his anointed one:
I have held him by his right hand
    so he could conquer the nations ahead of him,
        strip kings of their power,
            and open doors ahead of him
                so that the gates would not be shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will go ahead of you, Cyrus, and smooth out the rough places.
    I will break down the bronze doors and cut through the iron bars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give you treasures from dark places and hidden stockpiles.
    Then you will know that I, Yahweh Elohim of Israel,
        have called you by name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of my servant Jacob,
    Israel, my chosen one,
        I have called you by name.
        I have given you a title of honor, although you don’t know me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am Yahweh, and there is no other.
    There is no other Elohim besides me.
        I will strengthen you, although you don’t know me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that from the east to the west people will know
                that there is no Elohim except me.
    I am Yahweh, and there is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I make light and create darkness.
    I make blessings and create disasters.
    I, Yahweh, do all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rain down from above, you heavens,
    and pour down righteousness, you skies.
        Let the earth open.
            Let salvation and righteousness sprout.
                Let them spring up.
    I, Yahweh, have created them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How horrible it will be for the one who quarrels with his maker.
    He is pottery among other earthenware pots.
        Does the clay ask the one who shapes it, “What are you making?”
        Does your work say to you, “There are no handles”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How horrible it will be for the one
    who says to his father, “Why did you conceive me?”
        or to his mother, “Why did you go through labor pains for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is the Holy One and the maker of Israel.
This is what Yahweh says:
Ask me about what is going to happen to my children!
    Are you going to give me orders concerning my handiwork?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made the earth and created humans on it.
    I stretched out the heavens with my own hands.
    I commanded all the stars to shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I prepared Cyrus for my righteous purpose.
    I will make all his roads straight.
    He will build my city and let my exiles go free
        without any payment or any reward, says Yahweh Tsebaoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
The products from Egypt, the merchandise from Sudan,
    and the important Sabaeans will come to you.
        They will belong to you.
        They will follow you.
        They will come to you in chains.
        They will bow to you and pray to you,
            “Certainly El is with you alone, and there is no other Elohim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly, you are an El who has hidden himself.
    You are the Elohim of Israel, the Savior!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who make idols will be ashamed and disgraced.
    They will go away completely disgraced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel has been saved by Yahweh forever.
    You will never again be ashamed or disgraced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh created the heavens.
    Elohim formed the earth and made it.
    He set it up.
    He did not create it to be empty
        but formed it to be inhabited.
This is what Yahweh says:
I am Yahweh, and there is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I haven’t spoken privately or in some dark corner of the world.
    I didn’t say to Jacob’s descendants,
    “Search for me in vain!”
    I, Yahweh, speak what is fair and say what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come here, you refugees from the nations.
    Ignorant people carry wooden idols
        and pray to gods that cannot save anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Speak and present your case. Yes, let them consult one another.
    Who revealed this in the distant past and predicted it long ago?
    Wasn’t it I, Yahweh?
        There is no other Elohim except me.
            There is no other righteous God and Savior besides me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and be saved, all who live at the ends of the earth,
    because I am El, and there is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have bound myself with an oath.
    A word has gone out from my righteous mouth
    that will not be recalled,
        “Every knee will bow to me
            and every tongue will swear allegiance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be said of me,
    “Certainly, righteousness and strength are found in Yahweh alone.”
All who are angry with him will come to him and be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the descendants of Israel will be declared righteous,
    and they will praise Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The god Bel bows down; the god Nebo stoops low.
    Their statues are seated on animals and cattle.
        The gods that you carry are burdens, a load for weary people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These gods stoop low and bow down together.
    They aren’t able to escape with heavy loads.
    They go away into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, descendants of Jacob,
    the few people left of the nation of Israel.
        I’ve carried you since your birth.
        I’ve taken care of you from the time you were born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even when you’re old, I’ll take care of you.
            Even when your hair turns gray, I’ll support you.
        I made you and will continue to care for you.
        I’ll support you and save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom will you compare me and make me equal?
    To whom will you compare me so that we can be alike?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People pour gold out of their bags and weigh silver on scales.
    They hire a goldsmith. He makes it into a god.
    They bow down and worship it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They lift it on their shoulders and carry it.
    They set the idol in its place, and it stands there.
        It doesn’t move from its place.
        If they cry to it for help, it can’t answer.
        It can’t rescue them from their distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember this, and take courage.
    Recall your rebellious acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the first events,
    because I am El, and there is no other.
        I am Elohim, and there’s no one like me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the beginning I revealed the end.
    From long ago I told you things that had not yet happened, saying,
    “My plan will stand, and I’ll do everything I intended to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will call a bird of prey from the east.
    I will call someone for my plan from a faraway land.
    I have spoken, and I will bring it about.
    I have planned it, and I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to me, you stubborn people who are far from being righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll bring my righteousness near; it isn’t far away.
    My salvation will not be delayed.
        I’ll provide salvation for Zion
            and bring my glory to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go, sit in the dirt,
    virgin princess of Babylon!
    Sit on the ground, not on a throne,
    princess of the Babylonians!
        You will no longer be called soft and delicate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take millstones and grind flour.
    Remove your veil.
        Take off your skirt.
            Uncover your legs, and cross the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People will see you naked.
    People will see your shame.
    I will take revenge.
    I won’t spare anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our Go’el is Qedosh Yisrael.
    His name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go into the dark, and sit in silence,
    princess of the Babylonians!
        You will no longer be called the queen of kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was angry with my people.
    I dishonored those who belong to me.
    I put them under your control.
    You showed them no mercy.
    You placed a heavy burden on old people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You said, “I will always be a queen.”
    You didn’t carefully consider these things
        or keep in mind how they would end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now then, listen to this, you lover of pleasure.
    You live securely and say to yourself,
        “I’m the only one, and there’s no one else.
            I won’t live as a widow.
            I won’t suffer the loss of children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In one day both of these will happen to you instantly:
    the loss of your children and your husband.
    All this will happen to you in spite of
    your evil magic and your many spells.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You feel safe in your wickedness
    and say, “No one can see me.”
    Your wisdom and knowledge have led you astray,
    so you say to yourself,
        “I’m the only one, and there’s no one else.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But evil will happen to you.
    You won’t know how to keep it away.
    Disaster will strike you.
    You won’t be able to stop it.
    Destruction will overtake you suddenly.
    You won’t expect it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep practicing your spells and your evil magic.
    You have practiced them ever since you were young.
        You may succeed.
        You may cause terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are worn out by your many plans.
    Let your astrologers and your stargazers,
    who foretell the future month by month,
        come to you, rise up, and save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like straw.
    Fire burns them.
    They can’t rescue themselves from the flames.
    There are no glowing coals to keep them warm
    and no fire for them to sit by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is how it will be for those who have worked with you,
    for those who have been with you ever since you were young.
        They will go their own ways,
            and there will be no one to save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to this, descendants of Jacob!
    You are given the name of Israel.
    You are descended from Judah.
    You take oaths by the name of Yahweh.
    You acknowledge the Elohim of Israel,
        but you are not honest or sincere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You call yourselves citizens of the holy city.
    You depend on the Elohim of Israel.
        His name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the beginning I revealed to you what would happen.
    These words came out of my mouth,
        and I made them known.
    Suddenly, I acted, and they happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that you are stubborn.
    Like iron, you are hardheaded.
    Like bronze, nothing gets through your thick skull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why I revealed to you what would happen long ago.
    I told you about them before they happened.
    I did this so you couldn’t say,
    “My gods have done these things.
    My carved idols and my metal idols
        have commanded them to happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You’ve heard these words.
    Now look at all this.
        Won’t you admit it?
From now on I will reveal to you new things,
    hidden things that you do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are created now, not in the past.
    You haven’t heard about them before today,
        so you can’t say that you already knew about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have never heard about them.
    You have never known about them.
        Your ears have never been open to hear them before.
    I know that you’ve acted very treacherously
    and that you have been called a rebel since you were born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my name’s sake I’ll be patient.
    For my glory’s sake I’ll hold my anger back from you,
    rather than destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have refined you,
    but not like silver.
    I have tested you in the furnace of suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am doing this for myself, only for myself.
    Why should my name be dishonored?
    I will not give my glory to anyone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, Jacob,
    Israel, whom I have called.
        I am the one.
            I am the first and the last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My hand laid the foundation of the earth.
    My right hand stretched out the heavens.
    When I call for them, they both stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather together, all of you, and listen.
    What idol has revealed such things?
    Yahweh loves Cyrus.
    He will carry out Yahweh’s plan against Babylon.
    He will use his strength against the Babylonians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I alone have spoken.
    I have called him.
        I will bring him here, and he will succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come here. Listen to this:
    From the beginning I have spoken nothing in private.
    From the time it took place, I was there.
Now Adonay Yahweh has sent me and his Ruach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh, your Go’el, Qedosh Yisrael, says:
I am Yahweh your Elohim.
    I teach you what is best for you.
    I lead you where you should go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only you had listened to my commands!
    Your peace would be like a river that never runs dry.
    Your righteousness would be like waves on the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your descendants would be like sand.
    Your children would be like its grains.
        Their names would not be cut off or wiped out in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave Babylon; flee from the Babylonians!
    Shout for joy as you tell it and announce it.
        Shout it out to the ends of the earth.
            Say that Yahweh has reclaimed his servant Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They weren’t thirsty when he led them through the deserts.
    He made water flow from a rock for them.
    He split a rock, and water gushed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is no peace for the wicked,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, you islands.
    Pay attention, you people far away.
    Before I was born, Yahweh chose me.
    While I was in my mother’s womb, he recorded my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made my tongue like a sharp sword
    and hid me in the palm of his hand.
    He made me like a sharpened arrow
    and hid me in his quiver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to me,
    “You are my servant Israel.
        I will display my glory through you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I said,
    “I have worked hard for nothing.
    I have used my strength, but I didn’t accomplish anything.
        Yet, certainly my case is in Yahweh’s hands,
            and my reward is with my Elohim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh formed me in the womb to be his servant
    in order to bring Jacob back to him
        and gather Israel to him.
            (Yahweh honors me,
                and my Elohim has become my strength.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, Yahweh says,
“You are not just my servant
    who restores the tribes of Jacob
        and brings back those in Israel whom I have preserved.
    I have also made you a light for the nations
    so that you would save people all over the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is the Go’el of Israel, its Holy One.
This is what Yahweh says to the despised one, to the one scorned by the nation, to the slave of rulers:
Kings will see you and stand.
    Princes will see you and bow.
        Yahweh is faithful.
            Qedosh Yisrael has chosen you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
In the time of favor I will answer you.
    In the day of salvation I will help you.
    I will protect you.
    I will appoint you as my promise to the people.
    You will restore the land.
    You will make them inherit the desolate inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will say to the prisoners, “Come out,”
    and to those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves.”
They will graze along every path,
    and they will find pastures on every bare hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will never be hungry or thirsty,
    nor will the sun or the burning, hot wind strike them.
        The one who has compassion on them will lead them
            and guide them to springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will turn all my mountains into roads,
    and my highways will be restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come from far away.
    They will come from the north and from the west,
    and they will come from the land of Sinim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing with joy, you heavens!
    Rejoice, you earth!
    Break into shouts of joy, you mountains!
    Yahweh has comforted his people
        and will have compassion on his humble people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Zion said, “Yahweh has abandoned me.
    My Adonay has forgotten me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a woman forget her nursing child?
    Will she have no compassion on the child from her womb?
    Although mothers may forget,
    I will not forget you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have engraved you on the palms of my hands.
    Your walls are always in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your children will hurry back.
    Those who destroyed you and laid waste to you will leave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look up, look around, and watch!
    All of your children are gathering together and returning to you.
    “I solemnly swear as I live,” declares Yahweh,
    “you will wear all of them like jewels
        and display them on yourself as a bride would.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you are destroyed and demolished and your land is in ruins,
    you will be too crowded for your people now.
        Those who devoured you will be long gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children taken from you will say to you,
    “This place is too crowded for me.
    Make room for me to live here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will ask yourself,
    “Who has fathered these children for me?
        I was childless and unable to have children.
        I was exiled and rejected.
    Who raised these children for me?
        I was left alone.
    Where have they come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Adonay Yahweh says:
I will lift my hand to signal the nations.
    I will raise my flag for the people.
    They will bring your sons in their arms
        and carry your daughters on their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then kings will be your foster fathers,
    and their queens will nurse you.
    They will bow in front of you
        with their faces touching the ground.
    They will lick the dust at your feet.
        Then you will know that I am Yahweh.
            Those who wait with hope for me will not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can loot be taken away from mighty men
    or prisoners be freed from conquerors?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
Prisoners will be freed from mighty men.
    Loot will be taken away from tyrants.
    I will fight your enemies,
    and I will save your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make your oppressors eat their own flesh,
    and they will become drunk on their own blood
        as though it were new wine.
    Then all humanity will know that I am Yahweh, who saves you,
    the Mighty One of Jacob, who reclaims you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
Where are your mother’s divorce papers?
    Did I give her any to get rid of her?
    To which of my creditors did I sell you?
    You were sold because of your sins.
    I got rid of your mother because of your rebellion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why was no one here when I came?
    Why was no one here to answer when I called?
    Am I too weak to reclaim you?
    Don’t I have the power to rescue you?
    I dry up the sea with my command,
    and I turn rivers into deserts.
        Their fish stink because there is no water,
            and people die of thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I clothe the heavens in darkness
    and cover them with sackcloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Adonay Yahweh will teach me what to say,
    so I will know how to encourage weary people.
    Morning after morning he will wake me
    to listen like a student.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Adonay Yahweh will open my ears.
    I will not rebel, nor will I turn away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will offer my back to those who whip me
    and my cheeks to those who pluck hairs out of my beard.
    I will not turn my face away from those who humiliate me
    and spit on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Adonay Yahweh helps me.
    That is why I will not be ashamed.
        I have set my face like a flint.
            I know that I will not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who pronounces me innocent is near.
    Who will bring a case against me?
        Let us confront each other!
    Who accuses me?
        Let him confront me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Adonay Yahweh helps me.
    Who will find me guilty?
        They will all wear out like a garment.
            Moths will eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who among you fears Yahweh
    and obeys his Ebed?
    Let those who walk in darkness and have no light
    trust the name of Yahweh
        and depend upon their Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But all of you light fires
    and arm yourselves with flaming torches.
    So walk in your own light
    and among the torches you have lit.
This is what you will receive from me:
    You will be tormented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, you people who pursue what is right and seek Yahweh.
    Look to the rock from which you were cut
    and to the quarry from which you were dug.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look to Abraham, your ancestor,
    and to Sarah, from whom you are descended.
    When I called Abraham, he was childless.
    I blessed him and gave him many descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Yahweh will comfort Zion.
    He will comfort all those who live among its ruins.
    He will make its desert like Eden.
    He will make its wilderness like the garden of Yahweh.
        Joy and gladness will be found in it,
            thanksgiving and the sound of singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention to me, my people.
    Open your ears to hear me, my nation.
    My teachings will go out from me.
    My justice will become a light for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My righteousness is near.
    My salvation is on the way.
    I will bring justice to people.
    The coastlands put their hope in me,
        and they wait eagerly for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look at the sky.
    Look at the earth below.
    The sky will vanish like smoke.
    The earth will wear out like clothing,
        and those who live there will die like flies.
    But my salvation will last forever,
    and my righteousness will never fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, you people who know righteousness,
    you people who have my teachings in your hearts.
    Don’t be afraid of being insulted by people.
    Don’t be discouraged by their ridicule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moths will eat them like clothing.
    Worms will devour them like wool.
    But my righteousness will last forever,
    and my salvation will last throughout every generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Wake up! Clothe yourself with strength, O Yahweh!
    Wake up as you did in days long past, as in generations long ago.
    Didn’t you cut Rahab into pieces and stab the serpent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Didn’t you dry up the sea, the water of the great ocean?
    You made a road in the depths of the sea
        so that the people reclaimed by the Lord
            might pass through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people ransomed by Yahweh will return.
    They will come to Zion singing with joy.
        Everlasting happiness will be on their heads as a crown.
            They will be glad and joyful.
                They will have no sorrow or grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I alone am the one who comforts you.
    Why, then, are you afraid of mortals, who must die,
    of humans, who are like grass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have you forgotten Yahweh, your Creator?
    He stretched out the heavens
        and laid the foundations of the earth.
    Why should you live in constant fear of the fury
    of those who oppress you,
    of those who are ready to destroy you?
    Where is the fury of those who oppress you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Chained prisoners will be set free.
    They will not die in prison.
    They will not go without food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am Yahweh your Elohim who stirs up the sea
    and makes its waves roar.
        My name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I put my words in your mouth
    and sheltered you in the palm of my hand.
    I stretched out the heavens,
    laid the foundations of the earth,
        and said to Zion, “You are my people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Wake up!
    Stand up, Jerusalem!
    You drank from the cup in Yahweh’s hand.
        That cup was filled with his anger.
    You drank from the bowl, the cup that makes people stagger,
        and you drained it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From all the children she gave birth to,
    there was no one to guide her.
    From all the children she raised,
    there was no one to take her by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Twice as many disasters have happened to you.
    Who will feel sorry for you?
    Violence, destruction, famine, and war have happened to you.
    Who will comfort you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your children have fainted.
    They lie sleeping at every street corner.
    They are like an antelope caught in a net.
    They experience the anger of Yahweh,
        the fury of your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to this, you humble people
    who are drunk but not from wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh your Elohim defends his people.
This is what your Adonay says:
I’m taking from your hand the cup that makes people stagger,
    the bowl, the cup of my fury.
        You will never drink from it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will put it in the hands of those who made you suffer.
    They said to you, “Lie down so that we can walk over you.”
        So you made your back like the ground
            and like a street for them to cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Wake up! Clothe yourself with strength, Zion!
    Put on your beautiful clothes, holy city of Jerusalem.
    Godless and evil people will no longer come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shake the dust from yourselves.
    Get up, captive Jerusalem.
    Free yourself from the chains around your neck, captive people of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: You were sold, but no price was paid. You will be bought back, but without money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Adonay Yahweh says: In the beginning my people went to Egypt to live there as foreigners. Later the Assyrians oppressed them for no reason.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So what do I find here? asks Yahweh. My people are taken away for no reason. Their rulers are screaming, declares Yahweh. And my name is cursed all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now my people will know my name. When that day comes, they will know that I am the one who says, “Here I am!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of the messenger
    who announces the good news, “All is well.”
        He brings the good news,
            announces salvation,
                and tells Zion that its Elohim rules as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen! Your watchmen raise their voices
    and shout together joyfully.
        When Yahweh brings Zion back,
            they will see it with their own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Break out into shouts of joy, ruins of Jerusalem.
    Yahweh will comfort his people.
        He will reclaim Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will show his holy power to all the nations.
    All the ends of the earth will see the salvation of our Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Run away! Run away!
    Get away from there!
    Do not touch anything unclean.
    Get away from it!
    Make yourselves pure,
    you Levites who carry the utensils for Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will not go away in a hurry,
    nor will you go away quickly.
    Yahweh will go ahead of you.
    The Elohim of Israel will guard you from behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My servant will be successful.
    He will be respected, praised, and highly honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many will be shocked by him.
    His appearance will be so disfigured
        that he won’t look like any other man.
        His looks will be so disfigured
            that he will hardly look like a human.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will cleanse many nations with his blood.
    Kings will shut their mouths because of him.
        They will see things that they had never been told.
        They will understand things that they had never heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has believed our message?
To whom has Yahweh’s power been revealed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He grew up in his presence like a young tree,
    like a root out of dry ground.
    He had no form or majesty that would make us look at him.
    He had nothing in his appearance that would make us desire him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was despised and rejected by people.
    He was an Ish Makoboth, familiar with suffering.
    He was despised like one from whom people turn their faces,
        and we didn’t consider him to be worth anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He certainly has taken upon himself our suffering
    and carried our sorrows,
        but we thought that Elohim had wounded him,
            beat him, and punished him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was wounded for our rebellious acts.
    He was crushed for our sins.
        He was punished so that we could have peace,
            and we received healing from his wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have all strayed like sheep.
    Each one of us has turned to go his own way,
        and Yahweh has laid all our sins on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was abused and punished,
    but he didn’t open his mouth.
    He was led like a lamb to the slaughter.
    He was like a sheep that is silent
        when its wool is cut off.
            He didn’t open his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was arrested, taken away, and judged.
    Who would have thought that he would be removed
        from the world?
    He was killed because of my people’s rebellion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was placed in a tomb with the wicked.
    He was put there with the rich when he died,
    although he had done nothing violent
        and had never spoken a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet, it was Yahweh’s will to crush him with suffering.
    When Yahweh has made his life a sacrifice for our wrongdoings,
    he will see his descendants for many days.
        The will of Yahweh will succeed through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will see and be satisfied
    because of his suffering.
    My righteous Ebed will acquit many people
    because of what he has learned through suffering.
    He will carry their sins as a burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will give him a share among the mighty,
    and he will divide the prize with the strong,
        because he poured out his life in death
            and he was counted with sinners.
                He carried the sins of many.
                    He intercedes for those who are rebellious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing with joy, you childless women who never gave birth to children.
    Break into shouts of joy, you women who never had birth pains.
    “There will be more children of women who have been deserted
        than there are children of married women,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Expand the space of your tent.
    Stretch out the curtains of your tent, and don’t hold back.
        Lengthen your tent ropes, and drive in the tent pegs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will spread out to the right and left.
    Your descendants will take over other nations,
        and they will resettle deserted cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t be afraid, because you won’t be put to shame.
    Don’t be discouraged, because you won’t be disgraced.
    You’ll forget the shame you’ve had since you were young.
    You won’t remember the disgrace of your husband’s death anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your husband is your maker.
            His name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.
        Your Go’el is Qedosh Yisrael.
            He is called the Elohim of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yahweh has called you as if you were
    a wife who was abandoned and in grief,
    a wife who married young and was rejected,” says your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I abandoned you for one brief moment,
    but I will bring you back with unlimited compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hid my face from you for a moment in a burst of anger,
    but I will have compassion on you with everlasting kindness,”
        says Yahweh your Go’el.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To me this is like Noah’s floodwaters, when I swore an oath
    that Noah’s floodwaters would never cover the earth again.
    So now I swear an oath not to be angry with you or punish you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains may move, and the hills may shake,
    but my kindness will never depart from you.
        My promise of peace will never change,”
            says Yahweh, who has compassion on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You suffering, comfortless, storm-ravaged city!
    I will rebuild your city with precious stones.
    I will reset your foundations with sapphires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will rebuild your towers with rubies,
    your gates with sparkling stones,
        and all your walls with precious stones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your children will be taught by Yahweh,
    and your children will have unlimited peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be established in righteousness.
    You will be far from oppression,
    so you will not be afraid.
    You will be far from destruction,
    so it won’t come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If anyone attacks you, it will not be my doing.
    Whoever attacks you will be defeated by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ve created blacksmiths to fan the coals into flames
    and to produce useful weapons.
    I’ve also created destroyers to bring destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No weapon that has been made to be used against you will succeed.
    You will have an answer for anyone who accuses you.
        This is the inheritance of Yahweh’s servants.
            Their victory comes from me,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen! Whoever is thirsty, come to the water!
    Whoever has no money can come, buy, and eat!
        Come, buy wine and milk. You don’t have to pay; it’s free!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you spend money on what cannot nourish you
    and your wages on what does not satisfy you?
    Listen carefully to me:
    Eat what is good, and enjoy the best foods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open your ears, and come to me!
    Listen so that you may live!
    I will make an everlasting promise to you—
    the blessings I promised to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made him a witness to people,
    a leader and a commander for people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will summon a nation that you don’t know,
    and a nation that doesn’t know you will run to you
        because of Yahweh your Elohim,
        because of Qedosh Yisrael.
            He has honored you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek Yahweh while he may be found.
    Call on him while he is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let wicked people abandon their ways.
    Let evil people abandon their thoughts.
    Let them return to Yahweh,
    and he will show compassion to them.
    Let them return to our Elohim,
    because he will freely forgive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My thoughts are not your thoughts,
    and my ways are not your ways,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Just as the heavens are higher than the earth,
    so my ways are higher than your ways,
        and my thoughts are higher than your thoughts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Rain and snow come down from the sky.
    They do not go back again until they water the earth.
        They make it sprout and grow
            so that it produces seed for farmers
                and food for people to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My word, which comes from my mouth, is like the rain and snow.
    It will not come back to me without results.
    It will accomplish whatever I want
        and achieve whatever I send it to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will go out with joy and be led out in peace.
    The mountains and the hills
        will break into songs of joy in your presence,
            and all the trees will clap their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cypress trees will grow where thornbushes grew.
    Myrtle trees will grow where briars grew.
    This will be a reminder of Yahweh’s name
        and an everlasting sign that will never be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
Preserve justice, and do what is right.
    My salvation is about to come.
    My righteousness is about to be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one who does these things
    and the person who holds on to them.
    Blessed is the one who keeps the day of worship from becoming unholy
    and his hands from doing anything wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foreigners who have joined Yahweh should not say, “Yahweh will separate us from his people.” Castrated men should not say, “We’re only dead trees!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: I will remember the castrated men who keep my days of worship, choose what pleases me, and faithfully observe the conditions of my promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inside my house and within my walls, I will give them something better than sons and daughters. I will give them a monument and a name. I will give them a permanent name that will not be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will remember the foreigners who have joined Yahweh to worship him, to love Yahweh’s name, and to be his servants. All of them will keep the day of worship from becoming unholy and will faithfully observe the conditions of my promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will bring them to my holy mountain and make them happy in my house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be acceptable on my altar, because my house will be called a house of prayer for all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adonay Yahweh, who gathers the scattered people of Israel, declares, “I will gather still others besides those I have already gathered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All you animals in the field,
    all you animals in the forest,
    come and eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel’s watchmen are blind.
    None of them know anything.
    All of them are like dogs that are unable to bark.
    They lie around dreaming; they love to sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These dogs have huge appetites.
    They are never full.
    They are the shepherds,
    but they don’t understand.
    All of them have turned to go their own ways.
    Each one seeks his own gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each one cries,
    “Let me get some wine,
        and we’ll fill ourselves with liquor.
            And tomorrow will be like today, only better.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous people die,
    and no one cares.
    Loyal people are taken away,
    and no one understands.
    Righteous people are spared when evil comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When peace comes,
    everyone who has lived honestly will rest on his own bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you—come here,
    you children of witches,
        you descendants of adulterers and prostitutes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom are you making fun of?
    Whom are you making a face at?
    Whom are you sticking out your tongue at?
    Aren’t you rebellious children,
        descendants of liars?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You burn with lust under oak trees
    and under every large tree.
    You slaughter children in the valleys
    and under the cracks in the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your idols are among the smooth stones in the ravine.
    They are your destiny.
    You have given them wine offerings
    and sacrificed grain offerings to them.
    Do you think I am pleased with all this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You’ve made your bed on a high and lofty mountain.
    You’ve gone to offer sacrifices there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You’ve set up your idols beside doors and doorposts.
    You’ve uncovered yourself to the idols.
    You’ve distanced yourself from me.
    You’ve made your bed with them.
    You’ve made a deal with those you have pleasure with in bed.
    You’ve seen them naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You’ve journeyed to the king with perfumed oils
    and put on plenty of perfume.
    You’ve sent your ambassadors far away
    and sent them down to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You’ve tired yourself out with many journeys.
    You didn’t think that it was hopeless.
    You’ve found renewed strength,
    so you didn’t faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom did you dread and fear so much that you lied to me?
    You haven’t remembered me or cared about me.
    I’ve been silent for a long time.
    Is that why you don’t fear me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll tell you about your righteous ways and what you have done,
    but they won’t help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you cry for help,
    let your collection of idols save you.
        A wind will carry them all away.
        A breath will take them away.
            But whoever trusts me will possess the land
                and inherit my holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be said:
    “Build a road! Build a road!
        Prepare the way!
            Remove every obstacle in the way of my people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The High and Lofty One lives forever, and his name is holy.
This is what he says:
I live in a high and holy place.
    But I am with those who are crushed and humble.
        I will renew the spirit of those who are humble
            and the courage of those who are crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not accuse you forever.
    I will not be angry with you forever.
    Otherwise, the spirits, the lives of those I’ve made,
        would grow faint in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was angry because of their sinful greed,
    so I punished them, hid from them, and remained angry.
        But they continued to be sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ve seen their sinful ways, but I’ll heal them.
    I’ll guide them and give them rest.
    I’ll comfort them and their mourners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll create praise on their lips:
    “Perfect peace to those both far and near.”
    “I’ll heal them,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the wicked are like the churning sea.
    It isn’t quiet,
        and its water throws up mud and slime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is no peace for the wicked,” says my Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cry aloud! Don’t hold back!
    Raise your voice like a ram’s horn.
        Tell my people about their rebellion
            and the descendants of Jacob about their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They look for me every day and want to know my ways.
    They act as if they were a nation that has done what is right
        and as if they haven’t disregarded Elohim’s judgment on them.
    They ask me for just decrees.
    They want Elohim to be near them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have we fasted if you are not aware of it?
    Why have we inflicted pain on ourselves if you don’t pay attention?
Don’t you see that on the days you fast,
    you do what you want to do?
        You mistreat all your workers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t you see that when you fast,
    you quarrel and fight and beat your workers?
        The way you fast today keeps you from being heard in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this the kind of fasting I have chosen?
    Should people humble themselves for only a day?
    Is fasting just bowing your head like a cattail
    and making your bed from sackcloth and ashes?
    Is this what you call fasting?
    Is this an acceptable day to Yahweh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the kind of fasting I have chosen:
    Loosen the chains of wickedness,
        untie the straps of the yoke,
            let the oppressed go free,
                and break every yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Share your food with the hungry,
    take the poor and homeless into your house,
        and cover them with clothes when you see them naked.
            Don’t refuse to help your relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then your light will break through like the dawn,
    and you will heal quickly.
    Your righteousness will go ahead of you,
    and the glory of Yahweh will guard you from behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will call, and Yahweh will answer.
    You will cry for help, and he will say, “Here I am!”
Get rid of that yoke.
    Don’t point your finger and say wicked things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you give some of your own food to feed those who are hungry
    and to satisfy the needs of those who are humble,
    then your light will rise in the dark,
    and your darkness will become as bright as the noonday sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will continually guide you
    and satisfy you even in sun-baked places.
    He will strengthen your bones.
    You will become like a watered garden
        and like a spring whose water does not stop flowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your people will rebuild the ancient ruins
    and restore the foundations of past generations.
    You will be called the Rebuilder of Broken Walls
    and the Restorer of Streets Where People Live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you stop trampling on the day of worship
    and doing as you please on my holy day,
    if you call the day of worship a delight
    and Yahweh’s holy day honorable,
    if you honor it by not going your own way,
    by not going out when you want, and by not talking idly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then you will find joy in Yahweh.
    I will make you ride on the heights of the earth.
    I will feed you with the inheritance of your ancestor Jacob.
    Yahweh has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is not too weak to save
    or his ear too deaf to hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But your wrongs have separated you from your Elohim,
    and your sins have made him hide his face
        so that he doesn’t hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your hands are stained with blood,
    and your fingers are stained with sin.
    You speak lies,
    and you mutter wicked things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one calls for justice,
    and no one pleads his case truthfully.
    People trust pointless arguments and speak lies.
    They conceive trouble and give birth to evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They hatch viper eggs
    and weave spiderwebs.
        Those who eat their eggs will die.
            When an egg is crushed, a poisonous snake is hatched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their webs can’t be used for clothes,
    nor can they cover themselves with their works.
    Their works are evil.
    Their hands have committed acts of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their feet run to do evil.
    They hurry to shed innocent blood.
    Their plans are evil.
    Ruin and destruction are on their highways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They don’t know the way of peace.
    There’s no justice on their highways.
    They’ve made their paths crooked.
    Whoever walks on them will never know peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why justice is far from us,
    and righteousness doesn’t reach us.
    We hope for light, but we walk in darkness.
    We hope for brightness, but we walk in gloom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We grope like blind men along a wall.
    We grope like people without eyes.
    We stumble at noon as if it were twilight.
    We are like dead people among healthy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We all growl like bears.
    We coo like doves.
    We hope for justice, but there is none.
    We hope for salvation, but it’s far from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are aware of our many rebellious acts.
    Our sins testify against us.
        Our rebellious acts are with us.
    We know our wrongdoings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have rebelled and denied Yahweh.
    We have turned away from our Elohim.
    We have spoken about oppression and revolt.
    We have conceived and uttered lies in our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Justice is turned back,
    and righteousness stands far away.
    Truth has fallen in the street,
        and honesty can’t come in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truth is missing.
    Those who turn away from evil make themselves victims.
Yahweh sees it, and he’s angry
    because there’s no justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sees that there’s no one to help.
    He’s astounded that there’s no one to intercede.
    So with his own power he wins a victory.
    His righteousness supports him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He puts on righteousness like a coat of armor
    and a helmet of salvation on his head.
    He wears clothes of vengeance.
    He wraps himself with fury as a coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will pay them back according to their deeds.
    He will pay back his opponents with wrath and punish his enemies.
    He will pay back the people who live on the coastlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people of the west will fear the name of Yahweh.
    Those in the east will fear his glory.
    He will come like a rushing stream.
    The wind of Yahweh pushes him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then a Go’el will come to Zion,
    to those in Jacob who turn from rebellion,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is my promise to them,” says Yahweh. “My Ruach, who is on you, and my words that I put in your mouth will not leave you. They will be with your children and your grandchildren permanently,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise! Shine! Your light has come,
    and the glory of Yahweh has dawned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Darkness now covers the earth,
    and thick darkness covers the nations.
    But Yahweh dawns,
    and his glory appears over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nations will come to your light,
    and kings will come to the brightness of your dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look up, look around, and watch.
    All of your people assemble and come to you.
        Your sons come from far away.
        Your daughters are carried in their arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will see this and rejoice,
    and your heart will be thrilled with joy,
        because the riches of the sea will be brought to you.
            The wealth of the nations will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Many camels will cover your land,
    young camels from Midian and Ephah.
    Everyone from Sheba will come.
    They will bring gold and incense.
    They will sing the praises of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of the flocks from Kedar will gather and come to you.
    The rams of Nebaioth will serve you.
    They will be sacrificed as acceptable offerings on my altar.
        So I will honor my beautiful temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who are these people that fly by like clouds,
    like doves to their nests?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly, the coastlands wait with hope for me.
    The ships from Tarshish are the first to bring your children
        from far away.
    Their silver and their gold comes with them
        to honor the name of Yahweh your Elohim, Qedosh Yisrael,
            because he has honored you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Foreigners will rebuild your walls,
    and their kings will serve you.
        In my anger I struck you,
            but in my favor I have compassion on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your gates will always be open.
    They will never be closed day or night
        so that people may bring you the wealth of nations,
            with their kings led as prisoners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nations and kingdoms that do not serve you will be destroyed.
    The nations will certainly be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Lebanon’s glory will come to you:
    Cedar, fir, and cypress trees will come to beautify my holy place,
        and I will honor the place where my feet rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of those who oppress you will bow in front of you.
    All who despise you will bow at your feet.
    They will call you the city of Yahweh,
        Zion, the city of Qedosh Yisrael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You have been abandoned and hated; no one has passed through you.
    But now I will make you a source of everlasting pride,
        a joy for all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will drink milk from other nations
    and nurse at royal breasts.
        Then you will know that I am Yahweh, your Savior,
            the Mighty One of Jacob, your Go’el.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring gold instead of bronze.
    I will bring silver instead of iron,
    bronze instead of wood, and iron instead of stone.
    I will appoint peace as your governor and righteousness as your ruler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No longer will you hear about violence in your land
    or desolation and destruction within your borders.
        You will call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will no longer be your light during the day,
    nor will the brightness of the moon give you light,
        But Yahweh will be your everlasting light.
            Your Elohim will be your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your sun will no longer go down,
    nor will your moon disappear.
        Yahweh will be your everlasting light,
            and your days of sadness will be over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then all your people will be righteous,
    and they will possess the land permanently.
        They will be the seedling I have planted,
            the honored work of my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The smallest of them will become a family.
    The weakest of them will become a mighty nation.
    At the right time I, Yahweh, will make it happen quickly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Ruach of Adonay Yahweh is with me
    because Yahweh has anointed me
        to deliver good news to humble people.
    He has sent me
        to heal those who are brokenhearted,
        to announce that captives will be set free
            and prisoners will be released.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has sent me
    to announce the year of Yahweh’s good will
        and the day of our Elohim’s vengeance,
        to comfort all those who grieve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has sent me
    to provide for all those who grieve in Zion,
        to give them crowns instead of ashes,
            the oil of joy instead of tears of grief,
                and clothes of praise instead of a spirit of weakness.
They will be called Oaks of Righteousness,
    the Plantings of Yahweh,
        so that he might display his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will rebuild the ancient ruins.
    They will restore the places destroyed long ago.
    They will renew the ruined cities, the places destroyed generations ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foreigners will come forward and become shepherds for your flocks,
    and children of foreigners will work your fields and vineyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be called the priests of Yahweh.
    You will be called the servants of our Elohim.
    You will consume the wealth of the nations.
    You will boast in their splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will receive a double measure of wealth instead of your shame.
    You will sing about your wealth instead of being disgraced.
    That is why you will have a double measure of wealth in your land.
        You will have everlasting joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, Yahweh, love justice.
    I hate robbery and wrongdoing.
    I will faithfully reward my people’s work.
    I will make an everlasting promise to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then their offspring will be known among the nations
    and their descendants among the people.
        Everyone who sees them will recognize
            that they are the descendants whom Yahweh has blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will find joy in Yahweh.
    I will delight in my Elohim.
    He has dressed me in the clothes of salvation.
    He has wrapped me in the robe of righteousness
        like a bridegroom with a priest’s turban,
        like a bride with her jewels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the ground that brings forth its crops
    and like a garden that makes the seed in it grow,
        so Adonay Yahweh will make righteousness and praise
            spring up in front of all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Zion’s sake I will not remain silent.
    For Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest,
    until its righteousness shines like the dawn
        and its salvation burns brightly like a torch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations will see your righteousness.
    All kings will see your glory.
    You will be given a new name
    that Yahweh will announce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will be a beautiful crown in the hand of Yahweh,
    a royal crown in the hand of your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will no longer be called Deserted,
    and your land will no longer be called Destroyed.
    But you will be named My Delight,
    and your land will be named Married.
    Yahweh is delighted with you,
    and your land will be married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a young man marries a woman,
    so your sons will marry you.
    As a bridegroom rejoices over his bride,
    so your Elohim will rejoice over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have posted watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem.
    They will never be silent day or night.
    Whoever calls on Yahweh, do not give yourselves any rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and do not give him any rest until he establishes Jerusalem
    and makes it an object of praise throughout the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh has sworn with his right hand and with his mighty arm,
    “I will never again let your enemies eat your grain,
        nor will foreigners drink the new wine which you made.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who harvest grain
                will eat it and praise Yahweh.
            Those who gather grapes
                will drink wine in my holy courtyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go through! Go through the gates!
    Prepare a way for the people!
    Build up! Build up the highway!
    Clear away the stones!
    Raise a flag for the people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh has announced to the ends of the earth:
    “Tell my people Zion,
        ‘Your Savior is coming.
        His reward is with him,
            and the people he has won arrive ahead of him.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be called Holy People, Those Reclaimed by Yahweh,
    and you will be called Sought After, a City Not Deserted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this coming from Bozrah in Edom
    with his clothes stained bright red?
    Who is this dressed in splendor,
    going forward with great strength?
“It is I, Yahweh. I am coming to announce my victory.
    I am powerful enough to save you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are your clothes red
    and your garments like those who trample grapes in a winepress?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have trampled alone in the winepress.
    No one was with me.
    In my anger I trampled on people.
    In my wrath I stomped on them.
    Their blood splattered my clothes
    so all my clothing has been stained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I planned the day of vengeance.
    The year for my reclaiming you has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, but there was no help.
    I was astounded that there was no outside support.
    So with my own power I won a victory.
    My anger supported me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my anger I trampled on people.
        In my wrath I made them drunk
            and poured their blood on the ground.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will acknowledge Yahweh’s acts of mercy,
    and sing the praises of Yahweh,
        because of everything that Yahweh has done for us.
            He has done many good things for the nation of Israel
                because of his compassion and his unlimited mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “They are my people,
    children who will not lie to me.”
        So he became their Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all their troubles he was troubled,
    and he was the Messenger who saved them.
    In his love and compassion he reclaimed them.
    He always held them and carried them in the past.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they rebelled and offended his Ruach Qodesh.
    So he turned against them as their enemy; he fought against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then his people remembered Moses and the distant past.
    Where is the one who brought them out of the sea
        with the shepherds of his flock?
    Where is the one who put his Ruach Qodesh in them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where is the one who sent his powerful arm
    to support the right hand of Moses?
    Where is the one who divided the water in front of them
        to make an everlasting name for himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where is the one who led them through the deep water?
    Like horses in the wilderness,
    they didn’t stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like animals going down into a valley,
    they were given rest by Ruach Yahweh.
        In this way you guided your people
            to make an honored name for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look down and see from heaven, from your holy and beautiful dwelling.
    Where is your determination and might?
    Where is the longing of your heart and your compassion?
        Don’t hold back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are our Ab.
    Even though Abraham doesn’t know us
        and Israel doesn’t pay attention to us,
            O Yahweh, you are our Ab.
                Your name is our Go’el From Everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, why do you let us wander from your ways
    and become so stubborn that we are unable to fear you?
        Return for the sake of your servants.
            They are the tribes that belong to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your holy people possessed the land for a little while.
    Our enemies have trampled on your holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have become like those whom you never ruled,
    like those who are not called by your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only you would split open the heavens and come down!
    The mountains would quake at your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be like the fire that kindles brushwood and makes water boil.
    Come down to make your name known to your enemies.
    The nations will tremble in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you did awe-inspiring things that we didn’t expect,
    you came down and the mountains quaked in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one has ever heard,
    no one has paid attention,
        and no one has seen any god except you.
            You help those who wait for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You greeted the one who gladly does right and remembers your ways.
    You showed your anger, because we’ve sinned.
    We’ve continued to sin for a long time.
        Can we still be saved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We’ve all become unclean,
    and all our righteous acts are like permanently stained rags.
    All of us shrivel like leaves,
        and our sins carry us away like the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one calls on your name
    or tries to hold on to you.
        You have hidden your face from us.
        You have let us be ruined by our sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now, Yahweh, you are our Ab.
    We are the clay, and you are our potter.
        We are the work of your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t be too angry, Yahweh.
    Don’t remember our sin forever.
    Now look, we are all your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your holy cities have become a desert.
    Zion has become a desert.
    Jerusalem is a wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our holy and beautiful temple, where our ancestors praised you,
    has been burned to the ground.
        All that we valued has been ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Despite these things, Yahweh, will you hold back?
    Will you be silent and make us suffer more than we can bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was ready to answer those who didn’t ask.
    I was found by those who weren’t looking for me.
    I said, “Here I am! Here I am!”
        to a nation that didn’t worship me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I stretched out my hands all day long to stubborn people.
    They chose to go the wrong direction.
    They followed their own plans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These people constantly and openly provoked me.
    They offered sacrifices in gardens
        and burnt incense on brick altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sat among the graves and spent their nights in caves.
    They ate pork and in their pots made broth from unclean foods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said, “Stay away! Don’t touch me!
    I’m holier than you are.”
    They have become like smoke in my nose,
        like a smoldering fire all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
